iti26:1.1: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti26:2.1: “Mendicants, if sentient beings only knew, as I do, the fruit of giving and sharing, they would not eat without first giving, and the stain of stinginess would not occupy their minds.
iti26:2.2: They would not eat without sharing even their last mouthful, their last morsel, so long as there was someone to receive it.
iti26:2.3: It is because sentient beings do not know, as I do, the fruit of giving and sharing, that they eat without first giving, and the stain of stinginess occupies their minds.”
iti26:3.4: as taught by the great hermit!
iti26:4.1: Rid of the stain of stinginess,
iti26:4.3: they would duly give to the noble ones,
iti26:4.4: where a gift is very fruitful.
iti26:5.2: to those worthy of a religious donation,
iti26:5.3: after passing from the human realm,
iti26:6.1: And when they have arrived there in heaven,
iti26:6.2: they enjoy all the pleasures they desire.
iti26:7.1: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
